intro: Gauropsis guttulata, commonly known as the red-stemmed gauropsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and bract-like structures. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are reddish in color. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, contributing to its ornamental value.
